summary: This is an internal Bureau of Prisons email from a supervisory chaplain at FCI Ray Brook, reporting on religious services and inmate incidents at MCC New York for the week of July 18-21, 2019. It details behavioral incidents involving inmates, volunteer scheduling changes, a reported gang fight threat, and the addition of inmate Jeffrey Epstein to the CFSA roster.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as being added to the CFSA roster at MCC New York.

persons.name: Edgar Vinces
persons.context: A Saturday volunteer who, along with his wife, needed to complete training before resuming services.

persons.name: Blanca Vinces
persons.context: A Saturday volunteer and wife of Edgar Vinces, who also needed to complete training.

persons.name: Daniel Washington
persons.context: A Sunday Christian service volunteer who was notified of a service cancellation due to a reported gang fight threat.

persons.name: Inmate Encarnacion
persons.context: Interviewed and added to the CFSA roster alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Married couple who are both volunteers for Saturday religious services.
Both inmates were added to the CFSA roster on the same day by the chaplain.

events.title: Inmate Disruption at Jumah Service
events.description: An inmate (86461-054) caused a major disruption during the Jumah move into unit 5N, shouting and waving his arms, which agitated other inmates. He was later restricted from chapel services for 30 days.

events.title: Volunteer Training Notification
events.description: The MC notified the chaplain that volunteers Edgar and Blanca Vinces could not conduct Saturday services until they completed training on July 29.

events.title: Gang Fight Threat Cancels Service
events.description: A drop note received by a 5N officer indicated a gang fight was planned during the Sunday Christian service, leading to the service's cancellation.

events.title: Epstein Added to CFSA Roster
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was added to the CFSA (Central File Summary Addendum) roster at MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
FCI Ray Brook, 128 Ray Brook Rd., Ray Brook, NY 12977
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was an inmate at MCC New York and was added to the CFSA roster on or before July 21, 2019.
A significant security incident occurred involving a planned gang fight during a scheduled Sunday church service, leading to its cancellation.
The document provides a snapshot of the tense and disruptive environment within MCC New York, with inmates causing disturbances during religious services.
The communication is marked as sensitive/privileged property of the U.S. Department of Justice.
The report originates from a supervisory chaplain at FCI Ray Brook but details events at MCC New York, indicating inter-facility coordination.
